data.title: Classification and Phylogeny of the Microsporidia
data.meta_description: The classification of the microsporidia has undergone many changes since the first simple system was proposed by Thelohan in 1892. This has been necessary because each new system or each modification proved to be, or was thought to be, inadequate after a more or less...
data.text: The classification of the microsporidia has undergone many changes since the first simple system was proposed by Thelohan in 1892. This has been necessary because each new system or each modification proved to be, or was thought to be, inadequate after a more or less short period of time. The inadequacies have been of two general classes, those inherent in the employment of unsound principles of classification and those that automatically came into being when new kinds of microsporidia were discovered or old taxa were recharacterized.
